To be a potential donor for patient 1 who has blood type A, a person must have either blood type A or O, and therefore: P(D1) = P(A or O) = P(A) + P(O) = .42 + .44 = .86.
Note that in this case we can safely use the addition rule for disjoint events since the events A and O are disjoint.
Similarly, to be a potential donor for patient 2 who has blood type B, a person must have either blood type B or O, and therefore: P(D2) = P(B) + P(O) = .10 + .44 = .54.
